definition: poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth

sentences.english: Be he doctor or mere mister.
sentences.chinese: 不论他是位博士或只是一介小民。

sentences.english: Jeter replied that he did him a favor.
sentences.chinese: 而吉特的回应是小民帮了他一个忙。

sentences.english: Wang allowed four runs, six hits and three walks in six innings .
sentences.chinese: 小民被得四分，六局中被打六支安打跟三个保送。

sentences.english: The right-hander hasn't allowed an unearned run in his last 41 starts.
sentences.chinese: 因为，小民已经连续41场先发没有非自责分了。

sentences.english: My family name is Gao. I'm Ma Xiaomin's teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我姓高，我是马小民的老师。

sentences.english: The ovation got even louder when Wang doffed his cap in appreciation, in a rare display of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 当小民脱帽致意答谢时，满场的掌声甚至更加热烈。

sentences.english: However, when a batter squares him up and hits a liner, Wang is in big trouble.
sentences.chinese: 然而，当打者逮中击出平飞球时，小民的麻烦就大了。

sentences.english: Chien-Ming Wang will get one more start in the regular season, probably Wednesday against Baltimore.
sentences.chinese: 小民本季还有一次先发，可能会在星期三对上金莺队。

definition: poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
